intro: Rostellularia bankaoensis, commonly known as the Bankao rostellularia, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
